author: 0xsadcat
content:
tornado transactions are so rare impact on total mining profits would be basically zero, leaving ideology as the only possible factor to switch. Switching is manual work and miners are least likely to care of everyone.
Solo mining would be purely ideological because there were no mev relays, making it a loss making move, and in the long run literally impossible - because difficulty slowly rises to a level in which most efficient miners are the only ones making a tiny profit, which includes mev profits.
Legally pools are inherently public entities, making them much easier to attack than anonymous solo validator somewhere. This means that a situation in which all pools censor was a likely outcome, and there would be literally nothing to be done about it while keeping PoW.

Right now, empirically majority of mev enabled validators runs multiple relays which was confirmed yesterday due to a bug in reporting profits (as relays are trusted currently). Which means that full censorship right now is impossible as there's always a fee that makes most mev-enabled validators choose a block with tornado transactions. This is true even for pure profit-maximizing validators. Ideological validators don't have to run mev at all, and because there's no difficulty mechanism that only means lower profits, not a loss-making operation. It's also possible to run only non-ofac enforcing relays for a negligible profit difference.
